name: DMS pod count alert.txt - Issue:
description: This section explains that the number of pods (containers) for a deployment named 'sdlc' in the 'SDLC' namespace of a Kubernetes cluster has dropped to zero. This could indicate an issue with the deployment or the cluster itself, potentially causing downtime or service disruption for the application running in those pods.
use_cases: Monitoring pod counts for critical deployments
Detecting potential service disruptions or outages

name: DMS pod count alert.txt - Debugging:
description: This section explains that the issue of an incorrect DMS pod count alert could be caused by either an out-of-memory (OOM) situation or a node being unavailable in the ops-common cluster. It suggests that the root cause of the alert might be related to resource constraints or node availability problems within the cluster.
use_cases: Identifying resource constraints in a Kubernetes cluster
Monitoring node availability in a Kubernetes cluster

name: DMS pod count alert.txt - Resolution:
description: This section provides guidance on troubleshooting and resolving issues related to the DMS pod count alert. It suggests debugging by examining the pod logs and attempting to resolve the issue by rotating (restarting) the pod. Additionally, it provides a link to a monitoring dashboard for further investigation.
use_cases: Restarting or rotating pods to resolve issues
Monitoring DMS pods through a dashboard
